title: Capacity of Two-Layer Networks with Binary Weights
abstract: The capacity C_b of two later (N - 2L - 1) feed-forward neural networks is shown to satisfy the relation O(W/(lnW)) ≤ C ≤ O(W). Here N - 2L - 1 stands for the networks with N input units, 2L hidden units and one output unit. W is the total number of weights of the networks. The weights take only binary values and the hidden units have integer thresholds.
rights: No commercial reproduction, distribution, display or performance rights in this work are provided.
official_citation:
Chuanyi Ji and D. Psaltis, "Capacity of Two-Layer Networks with Binary Weights," Proceedings. IEEE International Symposium on Information Theory, 1993, pp. 434-434.
doi: 10.1109/ISIT.1993.748750
